intro: Oldenlandia umbellata, commonly known as the "Whorled False Sandwort," is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers that are clustered in umbels, giving it its scientific name. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slightly hairy texture. Oldenlandia umbellata is part of the family Rubiaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with similar morphological features.
